definition: a thorn in one's side
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
China/Chinese/surname Zhong
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
within/among/in/middle/center/while (doing sth)/during/(dialect) OK/all right
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
a thorn in one's side
pinyin: yan3 zhong1 ding1 , rou4 zhong1 ci4

sentences.english: She is a real eyesore in the group.
A famous because of who you water out of numerous thorn in the side of all of our men.
sentences.chinese: 阿水出了名的泡妞無數，是我們所有男人的眼中釘。

sentences.english: Professor Emerson Sillerton was a thorn in the side of Newport society.
sentences.chinese: 西勒頓教授是新港上流社會的眼中釘。

sentences.english: Cinderella is the thorn in her stepmother's flesh.
sentences.chinese: 灰姑娘是她後母的眼中釘肉中刺。

sentences.english: He aways treats me like enemy.
His friend has become a thorn in his side.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友已變成眼中釘肉中刺。

sentences.english: In fact, why not move that eyesore out now?
sentences.chinese: 實際上，爲什麼現在不搬出那個眼中釘？

sentences.english: He is a thorn in my side.
A thorn in the eye of the beast to the end.
sentences.chinese: 一直都是畜生的眼中釘。

sentences.english: He had been a burr under the saddle of the government in his time.
sentences.chinese: 在他那時代，他一直是當局的眼中釘，肉中刺。

definition: to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
traitor
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to seize power
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
arrogance/haughtiness
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
scoundrel/rogue/bully/villain
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
